alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Gusty winds well ahead of thunderstorms will impact portions of Litchfield, Berkshire, southeastern Ulster, Dutchess and southeastern Columbia Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty winds along a line extending from near Pittsfield to near Sheffield to near Walden. These winds are occurring well ahead of any thunderstorms. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Torrington, Poughkeepsie, New Milford, Southbury, Beacon, Great Barrington, Sherman, Pawling, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Brookfield, Plattekill, Canton, Pleasant Valley, Thomaston, New Hartford, Lee, Wappingers Falls and Lenox. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess
